datapack.title: PvP Arenas
datapack.description: Certain spaces on the server are designated as "Arenas" where pvp combat is encouraged and rewarded with Harmony.

datapack.title: Harmony
datapack.description: A scoreboard objective that accumulates when interacting with other players and decays while alone.

datapack.title: Charms
datapack.description: Tokens of quality time that may be minted by players with high Harmony.

datapack.title: Favors
datapack.description: Limited-time, server-wide benefits or special events that players can activate by spending a Charm.

datapack.title: Harmonized Chorus Fruit
datapack.description: A special Chorus Fruit made with a Charm that allows players to teleport to each other.

datapack.title: Endchanting
datapack.description: Enchantments one level beyond the vanilla maximum (for instance, Sharpness VI) are bestowed to players' equipped items when defeating the Ender Dragon.

datapack.title: Empowered Ender Dragon
datapack.description: The Ender Dragon is capable of summoning mobs, lightning, etc. More players makes the Dragon stronger.

datapack.title: Extra Experience
datapack.description: Certain activities grant experience, such as looting chests, taming mobs, or curing Zombie Villagers.

datapack.title: Haberdasher
datapack.description: Players can put arbitrary items in their head slot or create player heads at the World Hall.

datapack.title: The Porcelain
datapack.description: A custom dimension where players can freely use Creative mode.

datapack.title: Item Entity Persistence
datapack.description: Certain items, when named, will not despawn as entities.

datapack.title: Glowing Glow Berries
datapack.description: Glow Berries provide a brief Glowing effect when eaten.

datapack.title: Named Armor Stands
datapack.description: Name Tags can be used on Armor Stands.

datapack.title: Relic Items
datapack.description: Certain equipment, tools, or weapons may have a unique look, dropped by mobs or acquired by other special circumstances.

datapack.title: Mob Warding
datapack.description: End Crystals can be used to ward certain mobs within a 32-block cubic radius.

datapack.title: Event Announcements
datapack.description: The Ender Dragon, Pillager Raids, Wither, and Wandering Trader send announcements in chat when triggered by players.

datapack.title: Player Advancements
datapack.description: A slew of player-designed or inspired advancements are available to challenge.

datapack.title: Random TP
datapack.description: Players can teleport to a random place in the overworld by eating a Chorus Fruit at spawn.

datapack.title: Recall Whistle
datapack.description: Players can teleport to their current spawn point by using a Recall Whistle.

datapack.title: Sitting
datapack.description: Players can sit on upward-facing, empty Item Frames. The Item Frame becomes invisible while sitting on it and the player's sitting position is aligned to the logical height of the block that the Item Frame is attached to.

datapack.title: Cooperative Sleeping
datapack.description: The night passes faster when a player is sleeping. The more players that sleep, the faster night passes.

datapack.title: Spawner Eggs
datapack.description: Mob Spawners will drop a Spawn Egg of their respective mob when mined.

datapack.title: Speedy Paths
datapack.description: Sprinting on Dirt Path blocks gives players a Speed effect.

datapack.title: Visual Status
datapack.description: Players at critical health will emit "hurt" particles. Players who may attract Phantoms will emit "sleepy" particles. Players who are hungry will emit quiet "gurgling" sounds.

datapack.title: Wilderness
datapack.description: The "Wilderness" is the region outside the 10,000 block square radius around spawn that may be entirely reset for future versions of Minecraft.
